intro: Dampiera discolor, commonly known as the silverleaf dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and sandy soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Dampiera discolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance, providing nectar for native pollinators.
